prompt: The following frequency table shows the responses from a group of college students who were asked to choose their favorite flavor of ice cream. Which of the following statements is not supported by the table?

choices.value: The number of student responses is 300.
One-third of the students chose vanilla.
One-third of the students chose chocolate or strawberry.
One-fourth of the students chose mint chip or coffee.
One-half of the students chose vanilla or chocolate.

prompt: The following relative frequency table shows the political party affiliation for a sample of 500 people in a certain town. Which of the following statements is supported by the table?

choices.value: The number of people affiliated with the Republicans is 30.
The number of people affiliated with the Independents is 100.
Less than half of the people are affiliated with the Democrats or the Republicans.
At least 200 people are affiliated with the Democrats.
At least 80 people are affiliated with the Green Party or the Libertarians.

prompt: The following table summarizes the number of pies sold at a booth one day at a local farmers market. Which of the following statements is supported by the table?

choices.value: More cherry pies were sold than any other type of pie.
Twice as many apple pies as key lime pies were sold.
More than half the pies sold were apple.
Fewer than 50 pies were sold at the booth that day.
The combined percentage of key lime pies sold and pumpkin pies sold was less than 50%.
